title: Danny Ings can resurrect England career if his goalscoring exploits continue, believes his former manager Brendan Rodgers
text:
Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers believes Danny Ings can resurrect his England career if he continues to find the net on a consistent basis.

It was Rodgers who took Ings to Liverpool from Burnley four years ago. And he will face him again this evening when Leicester travel to Southampton where Ings has scored five times in his last four games.

Ings found the net in Rodgers' final game in charge on Merseyside when he netted against Everton and earned his first England cap just over a week later when he came on as a substitute against Lithuania.

But later that month he suffered an ACL injury which put him out of action until the final game of that season.

It put his international prospects on hold but Rodgers says it is not too late for an England recall.
description: Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers believes Danny Ings can resurrect his England career if he continues to find the net on a consistent basis.
